docs.abstract: It took Donald Trump to help get him there.
docs.snippet: It took Donald Trump to help get him there.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO — When Rosie Castro’s sons, Julián and Joaquin, were still in elementary school, she took them to countless political meetings in San Antonio, hoping they would learn to see the world as she did: a place that needed Mexican-American voices, like theirs, fighting for representation in the upper echelons of power. A place that needed them to speak with urgency about civil rights and racism.

headline.main: Julián Castro’s Mom Always Wanted Him to Be This Outspoken
headline.print_headline: A Son of an Activist,  Castro Finds It’s Time  To Raise His Voice

docs.abstract: In an interview with The Times, Mr. Dershowitz talks about McCarthyism (Martha’s Vineyard-style) and why nuance doesn’t exist in politics anymore.
docs.snippet: In an interview with The Times, Mr. Dershowitz talks about McCarthyism (Martha’s Vineyard-style) and why nuance doesn’t exist in politics anymore.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHILMARK, Mass. — This is what McCarthyism evidently looks like on Martha’s Vineyard.

docs.abstract: We asked, you answered: Is there another candidate you’d want to run for president?
docs.snippet: We asked, you answered: Is there another candidate you’d want to run for president?
docs.lead_paragraph: Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox.

docs.abstract: In Ohio, where companies like FirstEnergy and Goodyear pay no federal corporate taxes, Democrats haven’t figured out how to leverage anxiety over income inequality to defeat President Trump.
docs.snippet: In Ohio, where companies like FirstEnergy and Goodyear pay no federal corporate taxes, Democrats haven’t figured out how to leverage anxiety over income inequality to defeat President Trump.
docs.lead_paragraph: AKRON, Ohio — Colin Robertson wonders why he pays federal taxes on the $18,000 a year he makes cleaning carpets, while the tech giant Amazon got a tax rebate.

headline.main: Profitable Giants Like Amazon Pay $0 in Corporate Taxes. Some Voters Are Sick of It.
headline.print_headline: $0 Corporate Tax Bills Kindle Voter Resentment

byline.original: By Stephanie Saul and Patricia Cohen

docs.abstract: Invoking family stories of coming to America, many left-leaning voters in the multiethnic city of Racine say immigrants should enter legally.
docs.snippet: Invoking family stories of coming to America, many left-leaning voters in the multiethnic city of Racine say immigrants should enter legally.
docs.lead_paragraph: RACINE, Wis. — In this old manufacturing city that supported Hillary Clinton in 2016, dislike for President Trump runs wide and deep. Images of crying children at the Mexican border typically serve as Exhibit A on the list of grievances that Democratic voters cite against the president.

headline.main: In Wisconsin Swing District, a Range of Views on Immigration
headline.print_headline: A Melting Pot of Immigrants, and of Views on Immigration Laws

docs.abstract: With populism making a strong comeback on the left, candidates like Elizabeth Warren are decrying billionaires who might self-finance campaigns, like Michael R. Bloomberg.
docs.snippet: With populism making a strong comeback on the left, candidates like Elizabeth Warren are decrying billionaires who might self-finance campaigns, like Michael R. Bloomberg.
docs.lead_paragraph: With populism making a strong comeback on the Democratic left, liberals have found an early, enticing foil in the party’s 2020 presidential primary: billionaires like Michael R. Bloomberg who could bankroll their own campaigns or finance others.

headline.main: Democrats Find a Foil for 2020 Primary: Billionaires (Even Liberal Ones)
headline.print_headline: Democrats’ Newest Foil: Billionaires (Even Liberal Ones)

docs.abstract: Ms. Gillibrand’s campaign introduced a plan that would help new families with everything from diapers and nursery beds to paid leave and prekindergarten.
docs.snippet: Ms. Gillibrand’s campaign introduced a plan that would help new families with everything from diapers and nursery beds to paid leave and prekindergarten.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand’s presidential campaign on Wednesday introduced a proposal aimed at investing heavily in maternal and child health, adoption and in vitro fertilization, paid family leave and universal prekindergarten.

headline.main: Kirsten Gillibrand Proposes Huge Investments in Maternal Health, Child Care and Education

docs.abstract: Mr. Sanford, the former congressman and governor from South Carolina who infamously lied about hiking the Appalachian Trail, is considering taking on the president.
docs.snippet: Mr. Sanford, the former congressman and governor from South Carolina who infamously lied about hiking the Appalachian Trail, is considering taking on the president.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last summer, President Trump unleashed a last-minute Twitter attack that helped ensure the defeat of Representative Mark Sanford, a Republican from South Carolina who had dared to criticize him.

headline.main: Mark Sanford, Once Targeted by Trump, Weighs Primary Challenge Against Him
headline.print_headline: Sanford Says He’s Thinking Of Taking On The President

docs.abstract: Mr. Biden said he would not resume Mr. Obama’s deportation rate, which outpaced the first two years of the Trump administration.
docs.snippet: Mr. Biden said he would not resume Mr. Obama’s deportation rate, which outpaced the first two years of the Trump administration.
docs.lead_paragraph: The topic of immigration was, once again, a major point of contention during the fourth Democratic debate, with former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. under attack from hecklers as well as his fellow Democrats over the Obama administration’s deportation record.

headline.main: At Debate, Democrats Challenge Biden Over Obama’s Deportation Record

docs.abstract: The former vice president’s solution for inequality in schools touched on giving teachers a raise and playing a record player at night so children could hear more words.
docs.snippet: The former vice president’s solution for inequality in schools touched on giving teachers a raise and playing a record player at night so children could hear more words.
docs.lead_paragraph: The record of former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. on race and school desegregation once again came to the forefront during a Democratic debate, this time focusing on a comment he had made in 1975 on inequality: “I’ll be damned if I feel responsible to pay for what happened 300 years ago.”

headline.main: Biden Was Asked About Segregation. His Answer Included a Record Player.
